thread.title: Lady Falcons win in four sets over Lawton
thread.title_full: Lady Falcons win in four sets over Lawton

author: Corky Emrick
title: Lady Falcons win in four sets over Lawton
text: Lady Falcons win in four sets over Lawton Constantine, Centreville and Marcellus squads earn victories Comment Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 11:09 PM The Constantine volleyball team beat Lawton in four sets Tuesday night. After dropping the first set 22-25, Constantine stormed back to win 25-8, 25-16 and 25-20. PHOTO GALLERY “The girls came to compete tonight with a large ‘pink’ crowd keeping them fired up all night,”coachNiki Tulley said. “We had a great night passing and just played scrappy defense. Our hitters were playing a smart game and our blocking is much improved. I’m very proud of the girls and their competitive attitudes within the last few weeks.” HannahLey led the Lady Falcons with 15 kills, adding eight digs, four blocks and one ace while Mackenzi Dobosiewicz added 14 kills, adding 13 digs and three aces while Bailey Potter handed out 33 assists, adding four aces, 12 digs and two kills. Macey Tulley had seven kills, one ace and one block while Ashley Loose had five kills and nine digs. Paulina Diaz had five kills, two blocks and one dig, Kylie Walker had four digs and two kills and Rachel Corpe added 17 digs. Centreville sweeps Centreville picked up a non conference win Tuesday night, sweeping Colon 25-4, 25-14, 25-5. Leading the Lady Bulldogs were, Hannah marchand with 11 kills, 13 digs and one ace, Skyler DeMeyer had 13 assists, seven digs, four kills, one block and one ace, Hannah Rice added one kill and one ace and Andrea Bell had three kills, one dig and one assist. Carly Odom had one assist, Sara Lewis had nine digs and one assist, Madison Hunter had 10 digs, seven kills, eight assists and six aces, Bailee May added six kills, six aces, three digs, two blocks and one assist and Kalee Schrock had two digs and one assist. Colon individual stats were not reported. Marcellus quad Marcellus continued their winning ways, sweeping Kalamazoo Home School 25-13, 25-22, Kalamazoo Heritage 25-10, 25-10 and Howardsville Christian 25-10, 25-8. “We missed a few more serves than I would like and our passing could have been a little tighter, but our offense got back on track and our defense looked better,” coach Tony Hooley said. Elena Gemello had 22 digs, eight kills, six assists and four aces, Helis Sala had 27 kills and four digs, Aleyna Hutson added 16 kill, 25 digs and eight aces and Madison Fisher had 41 assists, eight digs and three aces. Rochelle Zachrich had 10 digs and six aces, Olivia Wildes added 13 assists and two digs, Grace Mihills had seven kills and four aces and Jade Sibley added eight digs and two kills.
